abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column describes puzzling details in case surrounding body of man found in snow in Saugerties, NY, in 1970; notes man, who had been shot four times in head, remains unidentified after decades of investigation.
lead_paragraph: A body found preserved by the snow in upstate New York in 1970 held many clues, but none have so far yielded answers about who the man was or who killed him.

headline.main: A Case So Cold the Dead Man Wore Pajamas Under His Suit
headline.print_headline: In Upstate New York, a Case So Cold the Dead Man Wore Pajamas Under His Suit

snippet: A body found preserved by the snow in upstate New York in 1970 held many clues, but none have so far yielded answers about who the man was or who killed him....
